p: Although the inability of entry screening measures to identify cases of SARS in the 2003 outbreak was known during the public health emergencies that occurred the following years, decision-making during the Influenza Pandemic (H1N1) 2009 and the EVD epidemic in West Africa in 2014/2015 seemed to be based on other reasons. Several authors suggest that screening measures in several cases may have been implemented mainly to relieve political and social pressure, and limit negative economic consequences from travel and trade restrictions [ 8], as well as to preserve public confidence [ 8, 9, 29] and maintain confidence that air travel is safe [ 6].
